segments.text: I find myself looking at the floor again, where the water is spreading.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s covering more and more of the linoleum, probably seeping into everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of sadness thinking about the potential water damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those cabinets are going to be ruined if this continues for much longer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the children, balanced so precariously on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It would be such a shame if one of them fell and got hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Broken dishes, bruises, maybe something worse – it's all possible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so peaceful, almost tragically unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn her about the impending mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This tranquil scene could turn into utter chaos in a second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's hard to watch knowing what might happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of them slipping on that wet floor makes me uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All these little dangers are building up, and no one is preventing them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly a somber feeling, anticipating all these potential accidents.
segments.speaker: PAR
